p: This study showed that the vinegar-processed products induced lower toxicity than raw C. phaeocaulis in a zebrafish model and rat model with blood stasis syndrome based on various physiological indices. Meanwhile, the volatile oil extracted from vinegar-processed products could inhibit the growth of intersegmental blood vessels, while the raw materials did not show such effects at the same concentration. Our findings confirmed the effects of C. phaeocaulis with reducing toxicity and preventing blood stasis after vinegar processed. Moreover, it laid a foundation for further animal experiments with larger sample size, as well as for in-depth study on the mechanism of synergism and detoxification.
